description: An offcial website for Association of Chinese Students and Scholars at Virginia Tech. I worked together with two other members of the club to maintain the website.
challenges: I had to consider the impact of image compression on the server's upstream traffic and the users' downstream traffic. In order to unify the resource management, I re-adjusted the format, size and aspect ratio of all the photos. Also, I need to optimize for mobile devices.

title: RunCat Localizaiton
description: I’ve liked this software for many years, but it never had a Chinese version, so I wanted to contribute to it.
challenges: I had to make a pull request (PR) — something I had never done before. I spent time learning how the PR workflow works, and carefully followed the process to avoid making mistakes that could cause issues for author’s project.

title: Personal Website
description: My digital home — built with React and MUI library — where I present my projects, share my blogs, and experiment with frontend design.
challenges: Static JSON file used as data source: if I want to add a project or a blog, I just need to modify the keys and values in the JSON file. The components will ”map“ these data.
Music player on the BlogPage: learning offical documention about design.
Optimized for mobile devices: use Drawer and Meta Tag to hide unimportnant components, thereby providing more space for the main content.
